result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William L. Bollom

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant William L. Bollom appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney William Schembera appeared on behalf of Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for William L. Bollom. Court orders any outstanding warrant quashed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/09/2022 at 1:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:22 AM- by Zoom) Defendant William Bollom appears in custody via video conference from the Chippewa County Jail without counsel. ADA Afton Lewis appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant executed. Court orders the previously ordered bond remains in effect. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/28/2022 at 2:00 PM. 
Hearing: 10/20/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Case called at 9:46 AM.
Defendant William L. Bollom not in court . Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for William L. Bollom.  Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kelm has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
State requests warrant.
Court orders $50.00 or  Body Only Warrant.

9:40 case called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William L. Bollom not in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court. Attorney Kelm has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and requests a new date. States does not object.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William L. Bollom in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for William L. Bollom. Attorney Kelm recently appointed and would like new dates.
Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
